data.title: Here are the major earnings after the close Thursday
data.description:

data.title: NexMetals announces upsizing of public offering to $80 million
data.description:
• NexMetals Mining (NEXM:CA) has increased the size of its public offering of units of the company from up to C$65M to up to C$80M.
  • Under the amended terms, the offering will consist of up to 14.04M units, and there will no longer be an over-allotment option.
  • The net proceeds from the offering are expected to be used to fund the prepayment of the first contingent milestone payment under the Asset Purchase Agreement for the Selebi and Selkirk mines, to advance exploration and development activities at the company's mineral assets in Botswana, and for working capital and general corporate purposes.
  • RJF is -0.49% to $157.465.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Copper Quest to acquire 100% interest in Kitimat Copper-Gold Project
data.description:
• Copper Quest Exploration (IMIMF) signed a definitive agreement to acquire a 100% interest in the Kitimat Copper-Gold Project.
  • The 2,954-hectare project is located 10 km northwest of Kitimat, British Columbia, within the Skeena Mining Division.
  • Copper Quest has until January 5, 2026 to complete due diligence before issuing 2M common shares to vendor Bernie Kreft as payment.
  • The project carries a 2.5% net smelter return royalty, with 40% buyback rights for CAD $1M.
  • Copper Quest retains a right of first refusal on any sale of the remaining royalty interest.

data.title: Flying into the future: Hood Riverâs drone ETF filing targets the aerial tech industry
data.description:
The rapidly expanding drone sector may soon welcome another investment vehicle, as Hood River Capital Management has filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission to launch the Hood River Drone Innovators ETF.

According to the filing, the actively managed fund will target âdrone innovatorsâ â companies that derive at least 50% of their revenue, research and development spending, or growth prospects from the drone ecosystem.Â 

This includes firms involved in manufacturing drone hardware, supplying key components and sensors, developing AI-driven flight management software, or deploying drones across industries such as defense, logistics, and infrastructure inspection.Â 

While the fundâs ticker symbol and expense ratio have not yet been disclosed, the filing indicates that the ETF intends to hold roughly 15 to 40 positions. However, the final portfolio size may fluctuate depending on market conditions and investment opportunities.Â 

If approved, the Hood River Drone Innovators ETF would join a small but growing field of drone focused exchange traded funds, including the REX Drone ETF (DRNZ) and the Defiance Drone & Modern Warfare ETF (JEDI).Â 

Furthermore, no specific holdings were provided, but if the new filing is anything like DRNZ or JEDI, then itâs possible to see the ETF hold stocks such as Palantir Technologies (PLTR), RTX Corp (RTX), Aerovironment Inc (AVAV), DroneShield Limited (OTCPK:DRSHF), and Ondas Holdings (ONDS).
